intro: Gordonia scortechinii, commonly known as the golden cup gum, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in pine flatwoods and wetlands. Its unique floral structure and habitat preferences make it an important species for ecological studies. The plant's ornamental value has also led to its cultivation in botanical gardens and landscapes.
